author: jason.carver
content:
> It is in the document I shared
Sorry, which doc?
> for the wit protocol to work fine we should generally agree on what we touch and what we do not touch
> and there are some non-obvious cases
> 1) do we touch a miner account when no reward and zero gas price are paid
> 2) do we touch SELFDESTRUCT recipient accounts if the transfer value is zero
> 3) do we touch precompile account if the value is zero
Yeah, I agree, I suspect we are okay to not consider any of those as touched, for the sake of the witness. Though even if we disagree on that, Trinity considers the witness information as auxiliary, and runs the basic beam sync anyway. So even if the witness is smaller than Trinity expects, beam sync should work anyway, just slower.
